column5: That is because of our local government. They limited it to 25 stores to start. More will be allowed soon. Other provinces have many more stores and some have only government run shops. All have a government run online store though.Sent from my SM-A530W using Tapatalk

Thunder Bay hotels are advertising dope vacations. Upon arrival at the hotel your dope will be there. Recreational dope in Ontario becomes criminal possession dope in Minnesota. Tell the border guard at Pigeon River "High" when entering the US. Rydens carries munchies for the "trip" back home.
I love the Black Pepper Jerky.
LOL Gummy Bears and Black Pepper jerky..... Sounds Great with an ICE cold beverage! You guys rock!

If you really want to have fun, make the trip to Bay of Quinte for your fishing trip.Not only will the fishing be good, but you will be very close to an area that has more weed dispensaries per square mile than in all of north america. I am not joking, there you will be able to purchase not only marijuana, but several different types of hash, honey oil, vape pens of all kinds,as well as edibles.You will be blown away on your first visit, I guarantee you that.

Anyone found any dispensaries around Fort Francis, or Kenora area? Hate to drive all the way to Kenora, but it would be a nice drive. I've been searching on the online but not much luck Thanks Guys and Gals
Check any of the Indian reservations. I know in south western Ontario in Oneida there seems to be more pot shops then smoke shops
No sir... I wasn't even aware there was one in Kenora. Someone had said to me the closest was Winnipeg.
I checked on line and in Ontario it looks like they're all on the eastern side. Closest it showed was north east of Detroit. Maybe that's considered south west?
Marijuana? Ontario has only Online sales at the moment, 9 stores in Winnipeg I think.
Thanks for the replies, Kinda shocks me that Fort Fran, or Kenora doesn't have a dispensary Soon I'm sure, stay tuned! Thanks again

Previous Govt of Ontario wanted it sold in Government stores and they only had a plan for 40 for 14 million people. They were morons who got punted from office, then the new Conservative Govt not lead by the smartest guy in the world let municipalities decide if they wanted a store or not. This basically caused the province to miss the Oct legal date. I suspect it will be a while before either of those spots get a store.
Guess I am out of touch with today. I thought the poster was looking for first aid stations. That's what happens when you get old.
If you go to the Ontario OCS website or the Manitoba LGCA website, it shows you where the legal stores are. Closest would be Sudbury, ON and Winnipeg MB.Sent from my SM-A530W using Tapatalk
That really surprises me. Go to Colorado and there's a dispensary on every corner. Sounds like a business opportunity. FF would be a ideal location being right on the border.
